data.title: Bruce Willis Biography
data.meta_description: Read all about Bruce Willis with TV Guide's exclusive biography including their list of awards, celeb facts and more at TV Guide.
data.text:
Fast Facts

Was born on an American military base in West Germany in 1955 and lived there for two years before his family moved to New Jersey

Suffered from a stutter when he was younger, but he soon realized that it went away whenever he was in front of a large crowd of people, which led him to try acting

Some of his jobs before acting: security guard at a nuclear-power plant, waiter and bartender in New York City, where he was discovered

Began his entertainment career as a harmonica player in the band Loose Goose

Still involved in music, he occasionally tours with his band Bruce Willis & the Accelerators and founded the blues label Uptop Music in hopes of signing unknown talent

Beat out more than 3000 actors for his breakthrough role in the series Moonlighting

Scored a Top 10 hit with "Respect Yourself" off his debut album The Return of Bruno---Bruno is his nickname---in 1987

Released a follow-up album in 1989 titled If It Don't Kill You, It Just Makes You Stronger

Awards

2013Independent Spirit Awards-Best Supporting Male: nominated

2006Critics' Choice Awards-Best Acting Ensemble: nominated

2000People's Choice Awards-Favorite Motion Picture Star in a Drama: winner

1990Golden Globe-Best Performance by an Actor in a Supporting Role in a Motion Picture: nominated

1988Golden Globe-Best Performance by an Actor in a Television Series - Musical or Comedy: nominated

1987Emmy-Outstanding Lead Actor in a Drama Series: winner

1987Golden Globe-Best Performance by an Actor in a Television Series - Musical or Comedy: winner

1986Emmy-Outstanding Lead Actor in a Drama Series: nominated

1986Golden Globe-Best Performance by an Actor in a Television Series - Musical or Comedy: nominated

1986People's Choice Awards-Favorite Male Performer in a New TV Program: winner
